speaker: Apprentices
lines: You find three apprentices debating how to hold an edge.
You hear files working along spines and bevels.
Chalk marks lie ready on the bench between them.
A schedule on the wall reads: heat, hammer, quench, repeat.
One hums a quench rhythm while stirring the trough.
Another flips a coin and watches balance and timing.
They notice you and ask what you want to practice.
They offer a tip you wonâ€™t find in a book.

choices.text: Catch the coin on the edge.
Carry a billet to the anvil.
